item.title: C4-aldehyde of guaiazulene: synthesis and derivatisation
item.description:
Org. Biomol. Chem., 2021, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D0OB02567D, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Georgia E. Williams, Gabriele Kociok-Köhn, Tony D. James, Simon E. Lewis
The C4 methyl group of guaiazulene can be transformed into the corresponding aldehyde in a chemo- and regioselective manner. This aldehyde is a versatile building block from which C4-alkenylated guaiazulenes that exhibit halochromism may be accessed.
To cite this article before page numbers are assigned, use the DOI form of citation above.
The content of this RSS Feed (c) The Royal Society of Chemistry

item.title: Synthesis of dibenzocyclohepta[1,2-a]naphthalene derivatives from phenylacetaldehyde and alkynyl benzyl alcohols via sequential electrophilic addition and double Friedel–Crafts reactions
item.description:

DOI: 10.1039/D1OB00057H, Communication
Archana K. Sahu, Ramanjaneyulu Unnava, Bipin K. Behera, Anil K. Saikia
A simple methodology for the regioselective synthesis of substituted dibenzocyclohepta[1,2-a]naphthalenes from phenylacetaldehydes and ortho-alkynyl benzyl alcohols in the presence of a Lewis acid has been developed.

item.title: A palladium-catalyzed cascade process for spirooxindole: an alternative way for the synthesis of spiro(indoline-3,2′-quinazolin)-2-ones
item.description:
Org. Biomol. Chem., 2021, 19,1795-1806
DOI: 10.1039/D0OB02580A, Paper
Abhilash Sharma, Dhiraj Dutta, Pranjal Gogoi
A palladium-catalyzed synthetic strategy has been developed for one-pot synthesis of functionalized spiro(indoline-3,2′-quinazolin)-2-one derivatives from 2-aminobenzonitriles, arylboronic acids and isatins. This cascade strategy proceeds via successive C–C and two C–N bond formations in a single reaction vessel.
The content of this RSS Feed (c) The Royal Society of Chemistry

item.title: Donor acceptor fluorophores: synthesis, optical properties, TD-DFT and cytotoxicity studies
item.description:
Org. Biomol. Chem., 2021, 19,1835-1846
DOI: 10.1039/D0OB02313B, Paper
Zahraa M. Essam, Guliz Ersoy Ozmen, Dani Setiawan, Riri Rizkianty Hamid, Reda M. Abd El-Aal, Ritu Aneja, Donald Hamelberg, Maged Henary
We report a series of NIR D–A fluorophores with a cyanoacrylic acid acceptor and various donor units. The cytotoxicity of selected fluorophores against triple negative breast cancer cell lines showed stronger activity than that of anticancer agent docetaxel.

item.description:

DOI: 10.1039/D1OB00023C, Paper

Unreported macrodiolides containing a 1Z,5Z-diene fragment have been synthesized. Their hybrid molecules with C60 fullerene was found to significantly increase the cytotoxic effect (from 5 to 170 times) as compared to the initial macrodiolide.
